== Tagging of X bugs ==

=== Kernel Graphics Issues ===

* kernel-handoff-graphics - Issues forwarded to kernel from X
* kernel-needs-review - Needs review by a kernel team member
* kernel-candidate - Has been reviewed by a subject matter expert, needs review for inclusion in top list

* kernel-graphics-vga  - Bugs pertaining to VGA graphics 
* kernel-graphics-resolution - Bugs pertaining to video resolution issues
* kernel-graphics-blankscreen - Bugs pertaining to blank screen resume/reboot 
* kernel-graphics-hdmi - Bugs pertaining to HDMI video out
* kernel-hotkey - Bugs related to hotkey/buttons not working 

=== Symptom classification ===
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=error-exit|error-exit]]</nowiki> - X exits with error code and error message
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=no-screens|no-screens]]</nowiki> - X exits because no usable screen configuration could be determined
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=crash|crash]]</nowiki> - X process terminates with backtrace / SIGSEGV
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=freeze|freeze]]</nowiki> - Can ssh into the machine, mouse cursor moves, but is otherwise hung / locked up / stuck in a loop
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=corruption|corruption]]</nowiki> - Screen shows garbage or mis-rendered graphics
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=tearing|tearing]]</nowiki> - a phenomenon in video where a newly rendered frame overlaps a previously rendered frame, creating a torn look as two parts of an object.
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=kernel-graphics-resolution|kernel-graphics-resolution]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=userspace-resolution|userspace-resolution]]</nowiki> (Was <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=resolution|resolution]]</nowiki>) - X starts with an incorrectly selected resolution, does not provide access to full range of expected resolutions, or fails in switching to alternate resolution
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=performance|performance]]</nowiki> - game fps is low, or perceived graphics display speed is below expectations
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=flicker|flicker]]</nowiki> - X blinks or flickers continuously or temporarily after startup, resume, etc.
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=dual-head|dual-head]]</nowiki> - problem setting up external monitor, mirrored or extended
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=backlight|backlight]]</nowiki> - on laptop, screen's illumination does not work properly
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=videoplayback|videoplayback]]</nowiki> - problem associated with playing video, such as using Xv
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=ghost-monitor|ghost-monitor]]</nowiki> - the video driver seems to be configuring around a non-existent output device
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=edid|edid]]</nowiki> - problem associated with EDID interpretation, often resulting in incorrect resolution detection
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=3d|3d]]</nowiki> - issue relating to 3D behavior
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=compiz|compiz]]</nowiki> - problem involving compiz functionality
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=resume|resume]]</nowiki> - issue that occurs following a resume from suspend or hibernation
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=cropped|cropped]]</nowiki> - screen is only partially displayed
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=font-size|font-size]]</nowiki> - fonts are way too big or way too small, usually because of incorrect EDID
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=kernel-graphics-blankscreen|kernel-graphics-blankscreen]]</nowiki> - screen goes completely black/blank on boot, or after suspend/resume, or during regular usage (Was <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=black-screen|black-screen]]</nowiki>)
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=vt-switch|vt-switch]]</nowiki> - problem occurs during or after switching virtual terminals (ctrl-alt-f#)
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=tv-out|tv-out]]</nowiki> - issue associated with the TV/HDMI/S-Video output
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=high-cpu|high-cpu]]</nowiki> - problem is associated with higher than expected CPU usage
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=pointer|pointer]]</nowiki> - problem relates to the display or behavior of the mouse pointer
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=error-message|error-message]]</nowiki> - a confusing or endlessly repeating error message
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=touch|touch]]</nowiki> - issue with touch support in applications or X
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=user-switching|user-switching]]</nowiki> - problem is associated to or triggered by user-switching

Preliminary (statically generated) unified report for -intel:  http://www2.bryceharrington.org:8080/X/symptoms_intel.html

=== Hardware ===

==== -ati driver ====

r100, r200,
r300, r400, r500, r600, r700 and rs690 (taken from
http://wiki.x.org/wiki/RadeonProgram).

==== -intel driver ====
Short names of the intel chipsets. Usually simplifed versions of the `chipset` variable in <nowiki>[[http://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/driver/xf86-video-intel/tree/src/intel_module.c|src/intel_module.c]]</nowiki> of the intel driver. This is printed in Xorg.0.log.
Chipset PCI-ID is also printed in Xorg.0.log and there is a list in <nowiki>[[http://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/driver/xf86-video-intel/tree/src/intel_driver.h|src/intel_driver.h]]</nowiki>.
Wikipedia has a nice <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel_GMA#Table_of_GMA_graphics_cores_and_chipsets|table]]</nowiki> that shows how each graphics core (GPU) relates to its chipset.
